laboratory_examinations.findings: RPD visible as subretinal conical lesions, deposits rich in vitronectin, photoreceptor-associated proteins, and Iba1-immunoreactive immune cells.
Immunoreactivity for vitronectin confirmed the subretinal location of several RPD, associated with a disruption of photoreceptor integrity.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Lipid Staining with Oil Red O
laboratory_examinations.findings: Oil Red O failed to stain RPD, indicating distinct lipid composition compared to conventional drusen.
RPD are located on the subretinal side and associated with photoreceptor disruption, leading to thinner ONL in affected regions.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: ONL thickness is significantly thinner in regions with RPD compared to adjacent areas without RPD; positive correlation observed between ONL thinning and increasing RPD area.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No TUNEL labeling of photoreceptor nuclei was noted in regions with RPD.
Localized upregulation of GFAP immunoreactivity in MÃ¼ller cell processes near RPD, indicating retinal stress.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased GFAP labeling observed in regions containing RPD compared to adjacent regions.
